intro: Echium lusitanicum, commonly known as the Portuguese thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces a tall, spiny stem. Echium lusitanicum is adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value.
